frame.name: Emergency
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame characterizes the situation or state of affairs in which someone should or must act to prevent a <fen>Undesirable_event</fen> from occurring. Often, an Entity affected by the <fen>Undesirable_event</fen> is more salient than the event itself and is mentioned in its place.
<ex>Jo had a <fex name="Entity">peanut butter chocolate candy</fex> <t>emergency</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Undesirable_event
FE.definition: <def-root>The potentially damaging event that should be prevented or ameliorated.</def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition: <def-root>The individual or valued object that is threatened by a worsening condition.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>The conditions in which the <fen>Undesirable_event</fen> occurs; or, the circumstances that explain the impending threat to the <fen>Entity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The location where the emergency situation arises.</def-root>

FE.name: Domain
FE.definition:
<def-root>The domain of the situation which the emergency is affecting.
<ex>While the exact numbers were still up in the air, it became clear that we were facing a serious budget emergency.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Experiencer
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the experiencer within the emergency action chain, often relating the person or group who feels or is threatened by the emergency.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). </def-root>

FE.name: Timespan
FE.definition: <def-root>The period within which an Emergency has occurred. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: emergency.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a situation requiring immediate action to avoid a bad outcome.
